It seems like it's... separate? The previous thing was about the component model, which I think is about boundaries? Whereas this is about adding WTF-8/16 strings to WebAssembly itself?

content.body: I looked through the issues and they're even considering WTF-8 literals (which goes against Simon's spec)... I hope this is not a thing that has wide buy-in.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I looked through the issues and they're even considering WTF-8 literals (which goes against Simon's spec)... I hope this is not a thing that has wide buy-in.

content.body: Well, I think now is the time to give feedback through your local wasm committee member... I decided this was pretty low-level and mostly language-ey and not web platform-ey so I didn't have very strong opinions.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Well, I think now is the time to give feedback through your local wasm committee member... I decided this was pretty low-level and mostly language-ey and not web platform-ey so I didn't have very strong opinions.

content.body: That is, it seems icky to introduce WTF-* strings into a new programming language in this day and age, but wasm isn't really a new programming language anyway, it's a compile target for old ones, so...
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: That is, it seems icky to introduce WTF-* strings into a new programming language in this day and age, but wasm isn't really a new programming language anyway, it's a compile target for old ones, so...

content.body: I also don't understand the zero-copy requirement. Given the myriad of JS string types JS engines have, that seems improbable.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I also don't understand the zero-copy requirement. Given the myriad of JS string types JS engines have, that seems improbable.

content.body: I think there's only generally two types, strings and ropes. Presumably ropes need to be flattened, but basic strings wouldn't.

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> hsivonen: I'll make that change and I'll also add beStrict to domain to Unicode for the same reason (URL has 2 callers for Unicode ToUnicode at the moment)

Thanks. Aside: It's super confusing what the level of operation reuse in ToASCII and ToUnicode is. It turns out that Gecko uses ICU4C's ToUnicode operation as the back end for both!
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
hsivonen: I'll make that change and I'll also add beStrict to domain to Unicode for the same reason (URL has 2 callers for Unicode ToUnicode at the moment)
